website_summaries.verdict: Works nicely for everyday ear cleaning, delivering a good value per ounce of liquid.
pros: Doesn't contain alcohol, making it safer to use regularly for ear cleaning
Will work for any age of dog or cat to help prevent ear infections
Contains a slight scent, but it's not overly strong
cons: Some animals may show a skin irritation with this, so test a little first

website_summaries.verdict: An effective, fast-acting cleanser that keeps ears clean without being too harsh.
pros: Cleanser can be used routinely on dogs with sensitive or chronically inflamed ears
Gentle formula isn’t drying or irritating, but keeps ears clean for long periods
Citrus scent is subtle and pleasant
Effectively breaks down built up ear wax quickly
cons: 4-ounce bottle is on the small side, you may run out quickly

customer_reviews.title: As a former veterinary technician, we used this product ...
customer_reviews.text: As a former veterinary technician, we used this product to clean cats/dogs ears and sold it to the clients too. I have a golden retriever and 3 cats, and I use this ear cleaner on all of them. It's important to clean your dog's ears after they go for a swim or get their ears wet to prevent ear infections. I usually squirt a little bit into my pets' ears and then massage at the base of their ears to get the product into all the crevices and mixed around, then I use cotton balls/pads and put them in and massage at the base of the ears again to get out all the gunk. This will help prevent ear infections!
customer_reviews.author: catdoglover

customer_reviews.title: Recommended 100%
customer_reviews.text: This product save me a lot of money (so far) and pain in my lil beagle mix. My baby have an yeast infection, almost every 2 month and this is after a medicine that cost me 25 dollar one ear. Since I am cleaning the ears with this not more issues (yeast infections or ear mites). In my baby case this product works miracle. I take the time to review because I am one of the Amazon customer that rely in others peoples reviews and experience, so I am trying to do my part. I recommended this product.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good safe and effective ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: As a retired veterinarian who gave up his license a bit ago I went back to what we used in the office-good, safe and effective ear cleaner that I could order without bothering the guys who bought the practice. If your veterinarian says you need to clean the ear canals on your pet there is a pretty good chance this is what they will recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gary0529

customer_reviews.title: Dog had horrible reaction.. twice
customer_reviews.text: This caused my dog ears to have a horrible reaction. Used as routine cleanser and his ears turned crusty and inflamed. Took him to vet and she said I should dry the ears with medical gauze following rinse as any moisture can cause yeast infections. Tried again (a month later) and carefully dried his ears as instructed. His ears appeared to burn, he scratched so bad his ears turned bloody, scabbed up, and look so very painful. I check his ears daily and prior to using this they were normal aside from some wax. So now i'm certain it's this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joia

customer_reviews.title: Like many other reviews (that i failed to read before ...
customer_reviews.text: My Jack Russell Terrier had an allergic reaction to the cleaner. Benadryll helped him. Like many other reviews (that i failed to read before using this product) spot test before using on your dog. My vet said vinegar is the best thing to use for dogs ears, so I will be using that from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vet tech
customer_reviews.text: I am a CVT and personally recommend this product to all of my clients. From animals that have severe otitis issues, to a routine maintenance cleaner, Epi-Otic advanced is the way to go! Its smell isn't too over powering (smells like fruit loops in my opinion) its a self drying solution, which is exactly what you want to clear/clean out your furry friends ears! I use it after bath time on both my mutts! Works wonders!
customer_reviews.author: pichie

customer_reviews.title: Very damaging to my shepherd's ears!
customer_reviews.text: I used this once, just wiping the inner flaps of my dogs ears. The next day his ears were beet red, swollen, and he was in a lot of pain. After 2 days, with no improvement, I took him to the doctor. The doctor couldn't believe the damage this cleaner did to his ears. He's now on antibiotics, steroids and ear cream. This $12 bottle of ear cleaner ended up costing me over $200 and a week of agony for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: A must have for dogs with flappy ears
customer_reviews.text: A must have for dogs with flappy ears. My Rottie gets the "ear crud" during the summer months and this stuff works wonders to keep his ears clean, gunk free, and it reduces the risk of ear infection. Its also the same stuff that my vet tries to sell me for 2x the price! It does smell a bit funny though, which you will notice when your dog flaps his/her head and gets it all over you... Otherwise, it's the best ear wash/preventative that I have tried (with several dogs over the past 15 years).
customer_reviews.author: prodiver22

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us! Waste of my money!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product regularly since I purchased it in February. Both of my 1 year old pittie mixes have never had any issues with their ears until I started using this. Both now have ear infections and the only thing that has changed in their routine is this product. Hundreds of dollars at the vet could have been avoided! I wish I had never spent the money on this, but you can't win them all. Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Goldendoodle Ears Clean
customer_reviews.text: BEST product for routine ear cleaning to prevent yeasty smell and ear infections. Easiest application: hold dogs ear and drip a tiny bit on their ear to let it angle downward into their ear, then massage it in and wipe residue with a cotton ball. It only requires 1/4 tsp of solution to get the job done, any more than that and your dog will likely hate the sensation and try to escape you. You get a better value for your money and the bottle lasts longer if you use this method. I clean my goldendoodle puppy's ears once a week to prevent moisture from being trapped under all of his fluff.
customer_reviews.author: Kailee

customer_reviews.title: Immediate reaction to my retrievers ears
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend. Applied as per instructions to my golden retriever's ears and the next day they were red/inflamed. Fortunately didn't have to go to vet, but this was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AdeM

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, smells pleasant
customer_reviews.text: Saw it used on a veterinarian's YouTube video about how to clean dog's ears all the way down into the ear canal. (Fill the ear with epi-otic, massage at base of ear near jaw until you hear wet sloshy sound. Dry external ear area then let the dog shake out any remaining fluid. Nice product, smells nice. And, after all, recommended by veterinarian. I warmed it under running water first then tested it on my wrist to make sure it was baby-bottle warm. My dog tolerated the cleaning with ease.
customer_reviews.author: SophieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I am not sure why this is so expensive as it appears to not really do a great job
customer_reviews.text: I was told that this was a good product for my dogs ears so I went ahead and purchased it. I used it as directed. It seemed to clean the wax out of his ears so I figured he was irritated from that. So I tried to use regulary and his little ears got Irritated still. They got red and what looked like a little swollen so I got nervous to use anymore. It states that is is not abbrasive and has antiseptic etc. I thought it was a more natural solution but I guess not for my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene A.

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my dogs ears smelled a bit and when I looked inside he had a lot of dark brown earwax. I ordered this to see if I could clean them out a bit before deciding if he needed to go to the vet. It worked wonderful and his ears are as clean as ever! I've also started using it after his baths to prevent any ear infections from brewing. However, he smells like walking, barking, chemicals for about a day after I put this in his ear. I actually call him chemical sometimes just for fun because of it. Overall, it works great and I would order again if I ever ran out!
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Burke

customer_reviews.title: Works great, does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I've had this on a subscription for awhile because I like to be sure I always have plenty on hand to use cleaning my dogs' ears. It has a pleasant smell but more importantly it doesn't burn if an ear is a bit irritated. I use it for regular weekly wipe down of the ears. I have one dog who has a tendency toward ear flareups and this helps to clear out his ear when he has a problem with that. I first learned of this brand from my vet, so I feel it's good and safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Maven Braeden

customer_reviews.title: Bad for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This does not have a strong enough drying agent for long eared dogs. It wouldn’t evaporate out of my dogs ear and caused an infection, cost me one hundred seventy seven dollars at the vet. The good earwash is $40 a bottle, not ten
customer_reviews.author: chuckwolfe1978

customer_reviews.title: To know whether you need to go the vet and not just have ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This ear cleaner is for dogs who don't mind their ears being poked around and had liquid inserted. I have 2 dogs. The older one, the minute she saw this in my hand will ran away. I had to catch her but even then she won't have her ears cleaned because the infection is too far away and she needs antibiotics and allergy shots. The younger one is a bit okay. I can have her between my legs and squirt this inside her ears but she will still run away before I can message her ears. At least I can catch her and do it without getting my blood pressure up and yelling.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Stays on skin for too long?
customer_reviews.text: This personally didn't work for me. I didn't see results. But what I really didn't like was that even a week after using it I could still strongly smell this in my dogs ears. I'm concerned with how healthy that must be, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly

customer_reviews.title: Ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great product and often times used by vet idustry, but at a much higher cost to the customer. I bought it b/c I knew it has a great reputation for effectiveness. I use it on my dog's who have ear problems. Of course, for infections, you have to visit your vet, but to keep the ears clean, this is a wonderful, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Giampaoli

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I have used many ear cleaners with my cocker spaniels over the years. This one is the most effective non-medicated one I’ve used. It’s great for cleaning the gunk out and keeping the insides dry. It does have a very strong smell. Also, if your dog is very sensitive, you might want to choose something else. It has a strong drying effect which is great for creating healthy ears, but can be painful for dogs with sensitivity. I recommend the cleansers with aloe for sensitive dogs. Sometimes I will alternate this cleanser with a softer one with aloe.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Gentle yet effective if I keep up with it
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time buying this ear cleaner for my Basset/beagle mix. She hates ear cleaning, but once a week Gertie gets this while I bathe her. Anything with alcohol stings and makes this situation even worse, and she's allergic to the scented stuff. This doesn't smell like a new car, but it's better than stinky ears. Plus no ear infections since I've been using this, witch was my objective all along.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Extremely efective
customer_reviews.text: My Golden has severe ear issues. She can go months without a single problem, and suddenly, and I mean suddenly, have the worst infection. This product was highly recommended by a fellow dog lover. She almost guaranteed, if I use the wash religiously, I will see a major change. I have been flushing my girls ears once a week for several weeks, and see beautiful pink ears. A few more months will tell the story, but I like the smell of the wash. It is pleasant, and not medicinal. Of course, the girl does not enjoy the liquid being squirted into her ears, but I truly believe she knows it is for her best interest.
customer_reviews.author: Barb eezz

customer_reviews.title: Clean ears!  No infections!
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this ear cleaner given my puppy's propensity for ear infections. This was actually vet-recommended. We used this ear cleaner before inserting medicinal ear drops during her last infection. The ear infection appeared to clear up pretty quickly, although this may be more related to the medicine. However, once per week, we give our pup this ear cleaner, and she has not had an infection since. She fought us a bit during the initial applications, but has learned to tolerate it over time. It has high smell that can last on the pup for awhile, but it's far from unpleasant - just initially noticeable for a day or so.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my cocker spaniels!
customer_reviews.text: This is the brand of ear cleaner that my vet uses, so it's the only one that I buy. I have two cocker spaniels that regularly need their ears cleaned in order to avoid ear infections. Now we clean them with this ear cleaner once a month and neither of them has had an ear infection in years. Years ago I had a cocker spaniel that had chronic ear infections and lost her hearing and had to have her ears sewn shut. All of that after seeing a professional groomer twice a month. This is simple to use and gentle and I have had no problems with this. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Serena Reed

customer_reviews.title: Clean ears makes for a happy hound
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for years to help maintain my basset and GSD's ears. First time using amazon so I tested a small section of my dogs ear before doing a cleanse. The product smelled like it should and did not cause any irritation. Results were as expected so I was very pleased. I only use this once a month to help maintain their ears not as a weekly thing. Also always remember to dry your fur baby's ear after your done. Get all that excess moisture out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ear wash
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product on the market. I’ve used other ear washes on my dogs ear mites and they use to burn her ears. With this product she let me use it on her and she loved it. No burning! No stinging! No pulling away and crying! Most have alcohol in them which causes the burning and irritation, this does not. It worked immediately and she was able to sleep through the night peacefully without scratching at her ear. I highly, highly recommend this for animal ear mites.
customer_reviews.author: JoeG65

customer_reviews.title: great for treating ear issues
customer_reviews.text: Ear infections are a problem with many dog breeds but especially bad for basset hounds. Their long ears cover the opening so little air gets in to help keep the ear canal dry and since they are prone to ear issues, that is a constant problem. Epi-Otic was recommended by my vet because it not only treats the ear but also has a drying agent that helps prevent infections. I have had bassets for years and used to foster them for a rescue group so this product has been my 'go to' solution for basset ears . It worked on my beagle as well.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: This groomer will never use another ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mobile pet groomer. A lot of cheap groomers will just use alcohol in the pet's ears (which can be super irritating) instead of spending the extra money to buy real ear cleaner fornulated for dogs. I used to use this at the vet I worked for all the time. I became so accustomed to using it, I still buy this product now that I have my own grooming business. It restores pet's ph and leaves a fresh scent in the ears. You can also use as a flush and it is so gentle on their ears. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: 2 happy clean eared cockers thanks to Virbac
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this, my dogs freaked out. Once they figured out what it did and made their ears less itchy, there are happy to sit and let me clean out their ears. I have cocker spaniels, which are dogs with huge floppy ears and long hair. This causes the ears to get really dirty and damp, which means ear infections are common. Now that I use this product I can go twice as long before my dog’s ears get half as dirty as they used to. After using this product their ears literally stay cleaner longer and they love the feeling of clean ears!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: this works well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stuff!! My German Shepherd was getting frequent infections in one ear only with lots of brown drainage, etc. She absolutely hated having her ear cleaned until I changed my methods: I soak cotton balls with this product and wipe out her ear till it's practically clean. There is no odor and she now tolerates the whole process without any problem. Now her ear is staying cleaner longer and she definitely hasn't had much of a problem with itching or fungal infection. This is a fabulous way to treat the problem without paying the vet $65 for an office visit plus the cost of medication.
customer_reviews.author: Kareful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Results
customer_reviews.text: My Shih tzu Bichon mix breed 13 year old dog has a history of chronic ear infections. Following vet approval, I started using Virbac Epi-Otic Advanced Ear Cleaner 3-4 times weekly. The vet informed me that this solution helps to keep his ear canals dry, especially after bathing, swimming, etc. In addition, it helps him to prevent a build up of ear wax. Following use of this product, I have observed a decrease in my dog's ear infections. I would recommend this product to anyone who has a dog with floppy ears. This product has a pleasant scent, is easy to use and is a good value for the 8 fluid oz size.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Only one that my dog tolerates..
customer_reviews.text: Most ear cleaners make my dog go bonkers and act like it hurts. This one seems to be gentle and she still doesn't like it, but she tolerates it. I use a cotton ball soaked with the cleaner and put it in her ear. I slowly squeeze it so the medicine comes out and goes in the ear canal. This is the best way I've found because otherwise she immediately freaks and shakes it everywhere! Have been using this for about 8 months and seems to keep her ears clean.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it! And so does my pupper!
customer_reviews.text: My oldest male dog suffers from chronic ear issues. He's a great dane/lab mix. The stuff the vet gave us left him more miserable then the build up did. And the smell was awful. We've tried several different ear cleaners and this one has been the best by far. Not only did it clean the majority of his ears but the horrible smell was gone. He even stopped scratching within a night! Hes so happy and back to his old self again! Would recommend this to anyone who has dogs with ear issues.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: I've tried dozens...this is the one.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab with chronic ear infections. This is the product that helps keep the yeast at bay better than aaaallll of the others I've tried. Regular cleanings with Epi-Optic and her prescription meds have really made a difference. I've been using it for 2 years now and would be hard-pressed to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Great Ear cleaner for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I work for Guide Dogs for the Blind. we use this product for ear cleaning for those dogs. I like it very much as it better than some of the other ear cleaners . sometimes we use it for ear infection. for flushing out the ears of the dogs. I got this product because it highly recommend by Guide Dog Vets. and I need something to clean my dogs ears that was gentle . I would defiantly recommend product for dogs. as it very gentle and highly recommend by vets.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Stafford

customer_reviews.title: I work in the emergency department of a veterinary referral ...
customer_reviews.text: I work in the emergency department of a veterinary referral center and can personally vouche for the fact that this is one of the EXACT SAME ear cleaners used and prescribed by veterinarians just cheaper and without having to pay for an exam. If your dog had icky ears, don't hesitate to buy! *not a substitute for medication to eradicate mites or otitis externa*
customer_reviews.author: kris Bishop

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a game changer for us! We have an English Cocker Spaniel with exceptionally long, dangling ears. Even with ear cleaner from the vet, she STILL had smelly, dirty, painful ears. I decided to give this a try. I use this with extra long dog q-tips and clean her ears 2-3 times a week. We have been using it for about 3 weeks and she is no longer crying in pain, and her ears no longer smell! I definitely recommend this if you have a dog that is prone to chronic ear infections/ear problems.
customer_reviews.author: Justine R Corbitt

customer_reviews.title: Dog seems to like having ear cleaned!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because we ran out of the same thing from our vet. Much better pricing at Amazon. We soak a large cotton ball and wipe out the dog's ear. It seems to not only clean, but must have some anesthetic properties since the dog calms down quickly after use. She grunts when we use the cotton ball with the liquid - apparently it feels good. The itch suppression is an extra bonus. I would not over-use it though - it may over-dry the skin in the ear.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Fan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing deal. My dog got an ear infection and I had to go to an emergency vet as my regular clinic was double booked. They tried to charge me $38 for 4oz of this EXACT product, which I KNEW was insane. When you have to pay all of the other fees and medicines you need to be able to afford all of them and extra in case of a re check. This came in packaged and nicely sealed, expiration date clearly marked and well packed with padding. Same item, same ingredients, same company, double the size and half the price. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Breyana

customer_reviews.title: Works like Magic
customer_reviews.text: First time dog owner here. A couple years ago I decided to save some money and start washing and grooming my dog by myself. I didn't realize dogs' inner ears can accumulate so much dirt and require regular cleaning. (I know. I was terrible.) His ears started to smell funky and not enough wiping can get rid of the odor. Finally I searched online and found this. Just one application got rid of all the smell! Now I know better and will do this regularly. My pooch is not scratching his ears anymore. I feel better about myself. Everyone is happy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accept no substitutions
customer_reviews.text: Don't use the store brand. This may be a little more expensive, but I just spent a week rinsing my dog's ears every other day, because he seemed to be building up an excess of liquid wax (his ears popped every time I touched his head). One use of Epiotic, and it not only removed all of that mess, but his ears have remained clean, and he's scratching less.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton Knowles

customer_reviews.title: terrible for our dogs
customer_reviews.text: the products made our pit bull and hound/lab mutt's ears worse than they were before. apparently they had a bad reaction to this product which they havent with other brands. it turned both their ears bright red and irritated them even more
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Does the opposite of what its supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Used this once just because I wanted to clean out my dogs ears, they were not particularly dirty, just a little normal wax. Flash forward 48 hours later and he's been shaking his head like every 5 steps and inside looks irritated. Will never use, no purchase this product or brand again. Avoid this product at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: prevents ear infections
customer_reviews.text: My dog would get several ear infections a year. I've been using this for years and it cut down on his ear infections big time. *Knock on wood* it's been several years since his last infection. I use it every time i give him a bath a massage it down into the elbow of the ear canal where the infections grow. I recommend this to everyone I talk to that has a dog that suffers from ear infections. If used properly, it will help prevent ear infections (this is not a cure. If your dog already has the infection you need to go to a vet). My vet recommended it to me and I'm nothing short of pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Luciano

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: I use this twice a week on our Havanese. She has never had yeast or ear infections. Her ears never have a bad odor! Easy to use. Check exp. date. Last bottle expired before I used it all. This one has long expiration date!
customer_reviews.author: Tee M

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Best ear wash I've ever used. Removes that black, sticky junk that comes out of our doggo's ear during an infection really well, even when gobbed in her hair. I flush the inside of her ear (by gently squeezing the bottle until it comes back out of her ear) and it doesn't bother her a bit. No odor, no oily residue, does not sting or burn. I highly recommend this product and I will never use any other ear wash product for our pup.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy E. Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: No More Stinky Ears
customer_reviews.text: I have a three year old pit bull named Lady, and recently after walks, her ears have been starting to stink. This solution helped clean out some visible ear wax and made the stink go away. I recommend this product if your dog has stinky ears as well! Something to note: if your dog is scratching their ears and the stink is really bad, don't use this product. It doesn't treat infections or allergies, so go to the vet before continuing the use of the solution. This product is great for regular ear cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are getting older so they’re accumulating a lot of ear wax. At one point they got an ear infection because of the scratching. We bought this and it’s been cleaning my dogs ears just fine. Mostly after baths and whenever I can, I put a few drops in their ear, gently rub the base of their ear, and CAREFULLY clean their ears with a q-tip. I go through a few q-tips with them if I don’t keep up with it but the product does the job. Haven’t had an ear infection since.
customer_reviews.author: lPad

customer_reviews.title: Been using this brand  for years
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike about this product We have 2 Golden Retrievers. That breed tends toward yeast developing in ears. Apply into ears and massage ear flaps and use cotton balls to clean ears if needed. Should smell test for yeast at once or twice a week. Use regularly and your dog will have clean ears that don’t itch.
customer_reviews.author: Tx Gal

customer_reviews.title: Golden Retriever who is prone to ear infections
customer_reviews.text: I have a Golden Retriever who is prone to ear infections if I don't pay close attention to his ears. The vet recommended some extremely pricy ear cleaner to keep his ears clean. That's fine if he has an infection, but I'd like to prevent them, not simply treat them when he gets them. So I purchased this and clean his ears about once every two weeks or if I notice that they're irritated or particularly dirty. The vet told me not to clean too often becaue I don't want to upset the Ph Balance of his ears. Since I've been using this product he hasn't gotten a single ear infection.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edmunds

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This is the same product I have bought at multiple different animal hospitals. It helps clean the ears well. I make sure to have one for each animal so I don't spread bacteria.
customer_reviews.author: Heather T

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly
customer_reviews.text: This really loosens up any dirt or debris in my pup's ear so I feel I'm getting them clean. I squirt it on a cotton ball then squeeze some of it in the ear canal, massage a bit then use it to clean out the ear. Has a good odor. He does not seem to mind. Used regularly and his ears stay nice and clean. Important for floppy eared dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: The Virbac Epi-Otic Advanced Ear Cleaner works great to keep our dogs ears from getting overly goopy way down inside. I guess because of her breed, this is a constant issue, so we use this stuff at least weekly. Needing it so often and considering the price, I would like to see a much larger amount available to bring down the long term cost.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Been using this for years
customer_reviews.text: This product works. I believe in Virbac veterinary products. Good quality and they work. This ear wash is perfect for when my dogs get irritated ears. When they scratch their ears a lot or stand with their heads tilted, I know it's time for the ear wash. They don't like when I pour this in their ears, but after I do their irritation is gone within a manner of 30 minutes or so. Excellent product and great price.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality
customer_reviews.text: My dog (chihuahua) has been prone to getting a tar like substance in his ears. If left untreated, it begins to turn into a white yeast substance. This causes him great discomfort as he incessantly itches at his ear and whines in pain. This cleaner has kept his ears clean and free from any pain! It’s a great price for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Sotelo

customer_reviews.title: Great ear cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the recommendation of a great pyrenees forum. When we got our dog, she had an ear that had black goop in it this, cleaned it pretty good and after she comes back from the groomer we use it to dry out her ears. She doesn't like anything in her ears so I might have exaggerated the ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte McIntosh

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap but it works
customer_reviews.text: I have a black Labrador that is always swimming and getting water in her ears so I have a big problem with her getting ear infections. Using this stuff weekly when she is heavily water active has prevented infections and trips to the vet. I highly recommend this product to anyone who’s dog is prone to ear infections for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for floppy ears!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only ear cleaner I use for my labs. Floppy ears require a cleaner with a drying agent. This was recommended by the vet and I have used it since. It is gentle on their ears, keeps them clean, is not too strongly scented, and leaves no stickiness on their fur. Will never use anything since!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t use anything else
customer_reviews.text: Since being introduced to this ear cleaner when I worked in veterinary medicine, I believe in this product. It helps prevent ear infections. It’s safe enough to use every day and it smells good. More importantly, it doesn’t have anything that could irritate my dogs ears or cause discomfort. I was happy to find it on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Felter

customer_reviews.title: ok stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Malacetic Otic Pet Ear/Skin Cleanser. Decided to try this stuff instead bc it is a bit cheaper. But after I use up this bottle, I'm going to start buying the malacetic again. Just am not as impressed with the virbac (due to contents)...WHICH of course I should have read before ordering. Lesson learned!!!
customer_reviews.author: art teacher

customer_reviews.title: HURT MY DOGS EAR!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff caused my German Shepherd's ear to become red, swollen, and caused the skin to flake and crack. I'm absolutely LIVID! Luckily I had some ear ointment from our vet, and that helped with the side effects STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Candace R.

customer_reviews.title: Best ear wash for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the recommendation of a popular vet i follow on Instagram. My toy poodles ears have never smelt fresher or cleaner. Far better than the prescription wash his vet sold me and way less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: lisa c.

customer_reviews.title: Best to Clean Ears With
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stuff to clean your dogs ears with. My dog won't let me squirt this in his ears anymore, but he loves me to clean his ears. So now I put some in a glass and put my Qtips in the glass to get one side wet and then I clean his years. Or put some on a rag and wipe his ears with it. WORKS PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.author: Jem

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT and smells good!
customer_reviews.text: Our Shar Pei is prone to chronic ear infections and this was what our vet recommended for weekly maintenance. Easy to use and a little goes a long way. We’ve been cleaning her ears with this product for 2 years and it’s worked wonderfully. It does have a mild clean scent, but nothing offensive. I’ve used others products that’s smell horrendous and this one is far from that. Price is great, a dollar or so cheaper than our vet. One bottle lasts a few months. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom & Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: Give it two star because: First, it really works for dog ear mites. BUT!! This is a very strong product that’s definitely not for sensitive skin! I don’t even think my boy has really sensitive skin. This product still cause his ear has a lot of red spot and he’s very resist on using this product After two use I just threw this away. Find some product work and gentle. NOT RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: She tends to get dirty ears very quickly
customer_reviews.text: This works INCREDIBLY well for my puppy. She tends to get dirty ears very quickly, and her ears had been bothering her to the point that she'd almost scratch them raw. After a quick look, I noticed her ears were filthy and decided I needed to get something to clean them ASAP. I'm delighted that I found this! I simply follow the instructions provided (with the help of someone holding her down) and then her ears are perfectly clean. I've never needed to do it more than once per ear at a time. I'd very, very strongly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: I thought my old dog was deaf
customer_reviews.text: My poor dog, he's old and I *thought* deaf. He couldn't hear any body. So sad. But after I washed his ears w/ this - within a day or so he shook his head and out came a blob of goo...and he could hear again!!! So happy now :) I watched a video on YouTube that recommended this stuff & taught how to massage it in to the canal really good.
customer_reviews.author: Follow Jesus

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is one of the best thing on the market for cleaning my animals ears, I use it on my cats and it truly works my precious cat Joey suffered from a terrible ear disorder when he was a kitten I had to clean his ears everyday for almost a year this was the stuff I used and now thank God he's a healthy cat, I truly believe this stuff helped him , I will continue to purchase this stuff as long as I have animals
customer_reviews.author: kozy

customer_reviews.title: My Vet Recommends
customer_reviews.text: My Vet uses this product and initially purchased through their office. Since then, have found it on Amazon much cheaper. My Vet has said to never use ear cleaner with water as it doesn't evaporate very well and can make ear infections worse or even cause infections. Highly recommend Virbac Epi-Otic. Wish I could find the 24oz bottle as it seems to have been discontinued, last I looked.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended ear cleaner for dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best products to keep my dogs ears clean. I use makeup pads liberally infused with Epi-Otic to clean their ears out. I tried another product which also worked good but then the changed the formula making it 'all natural' and it didn't work anymore. This is the same cleaner prescribed by my vet but at nearly $5 to $7 less based on what Amazon charges the particular day. :-)
customer_reviews.author: MrBOFH

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Works!
customer_reviews.text: Our vet introduced us to this ear wash. We have a shih tzu who has lots of ear problems, this is the only ear wash that we have ever found that comes close to helping. Our dog is so bad off she has to have antiboics put in her ears several times a year. I swear by this ear wash. If your dog has super dirty ears you may need to use it more often at begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gentle and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Our elderly cat has ear cancer and prone to infections and sores. We have to clean her ears daily to help keep infections to a minimum. This was a good size bottle for the price and easy to use- it’s a squirt type bottle top. It was a gentle solution that didn’t seem to dry out her ear as much as our previous brand so we will be using this from now on. Much cheaper on Amazon than thru the vet.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherBTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If your animal has an ear infection this will not fix it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for general cleaning your pets ears. I have 4 poodles an ear care is important. But if you animal has an infection this will not cure it. It will provide temporary comfort from the itching and constant shaking of their head but will still need to be seen by your vet.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Hill

customer_reviews.title: Saw results the next day! Smells great!
customer_reviews.text: My shih tzu had very gross smelling, ear wax filled ears. I apply the Zymox brand in her ear then this on a paper towel to rub on the ear canal. The smell is wonderful and I've seen the ear wax completely (and painlessly!) come out of my dogs ears in globs! This routine is something I recommend for anyone whose dog suffers from annoying ear wax!
customer_reviews.author: Cierra

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I made this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I made this purchase! My dog Nahla used to get ear infections all the time!! I felt so bad for her discomfort (always rubbing and scratching her ears). I started using this cleaner after reading some of the other reviews (her Vet once prescribed her with a similar product). After her last ear infection, I started using this cleaner once every 2-3 weeks. Since I started using it, she has not had another ear infection. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Née

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: I have used this before. My Cocker Spaniel’s ears suddenly had a lot of wax this summer. Cleaning them out with a QTip was not sufficient. Right now I use it twice a week and the wax build up is lessening. He loves how his ears feel after the application and rubs his head back and forth on the rug. A happy dog with fresh smelling ears. Great product that had once been recommended by my veterinarian.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Waters customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with chronic ear infections because for whatever reason a lot of smelly ear wax builds up. I used this stuff once and all the crap in his ears came out almost instantly into the cotton ball. His ear came out much cleaner. Just be careful when the cat shakes cause the stuff will gets everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: A must have for owners of floppy eared dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff! My little pup has hairy, long, floppy ears and is prone to infections. I drop some of this in each of her ears after her baths and it keeps them in perfect health! (I also use the ear powder pictured to help remove inner ear hair more easily) 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Courtney "Mother of Plants" Smith

customer_reviews.title: Caused healthy ears to be inflamed and red
customer_reviews.text: My lab has not had any problems with her ears besides water in them after swimming. That is why I purchased this. After the first use, within a day her ears became red and inflamed. Her ears have always been healthy. Unfortunately this didn’t work for us, so be careful if you order.
customer_reviews.author: kguida

customer_reviews.title: Great for swimmers
customer_reviews.text: we went from having ear infections constantly (3 or more per month) to not having any since using this product. My crew (2lg breeds) swim daily and kept infections - we would get rx drops clear infection and be back with another infection 5-7 days later 😐 since using this every night or two (3mos now) we are staying infection free.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: keep ear infections awy with Virbac
customer_reviews.text: the best should always use after a bath because it dries the ears out from what water gets in that you don't get when drying him off which keeps ears clean and from getting ear infections I would use weekly if you have a dog prone to ear infection once you start your problem will go away it has worked for my dogs for years and they never go to the vet anymore for ear infections.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite ear cleaner. Dont be afraid to hear that good squishy sound when working the cleaner in the ear. Massage it good then I like to use cotton rounds to remove excess debris and clean outside of the ear. Never put anything into your pet's ear canal!
customer_reviews.author: Magic

customer_reviews.title: English Bulldog
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't write detailed reviews but this is a great product. My bulldog's ears are clean and fresh with the use of this cleaner several times per week. It has a "soapy" consistency and smells fresh. My dog loves having his ears cleaned now. As an added bonus, if you own a bulldog this stuff also works great for wiping out/cleaning the dewlap wrinkle above his nose. Stays clean and dry with no irritation. I've had this breed my whole life and have never found a product that works this well for the folds on a bulldog's face. Wet a paper towel with it and wipe it out. Done. Excellent formula.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Basset Hound Ears.
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this cleaner. I use it on two Basset hounds who frequently need some ear maintenance. Took care of their ear irritation and the odor. Left them smelling clean and feeling good. Was concerned about the smaller size (compared to the “non-advanced” bigger bottle) but I quickly found out that I did not have to use it as often as the other version.
customer_reviews.author: Coop

customer_reviews.title: Just use a small cotton wipe and soak it with this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I took a cotton wipe and poured the ear cleaner on it, enough so when I wiped my dogs ears some of the solution would run into his ear. I know my dog would not let me pour anything in his ear so I wiped as much as I could with a wipe deep down. Regardless, it work very very well. His ears look very clean and he hasn't been trying to scratch them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Batista

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ear cleaner. The first few times I cleaned my puppy's ears, I followed directions and sprayed the liquid in her ear. She did NOT like that. So, I started wetting a cotton ball and wiping out her ears with it. After I use the cotton ball, I wet a q-tip and clean up the little areas that I missed. I like that it has drying properties and I don't have to worry about it giving her ear infections or water in her ears.
customer_reviews.author: Marbear

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! Every time my dogs go to the groomer they still have a little bit of water in their ears so they keep shaking their heads. As little spray of this and the inner ear dries quickly. They never have a dirty ear scent either!
customer_reviews.author: erisgroup

customer_reviews.title: The best ear cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I used to use watered down rubbing alcohol, but my vet informed me that it could be making ear infections worse and to stick to using this stuff. Since I've been using it the ear infections have completely gone away in both of my dogs that are prone to them! Regular use of this stuff means fewer infections and less ear maintenance overall- a win for you AND your pet!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: smells very good and deep cleansing
customer_reviews.text: I love this and my dog does too. the other cleansers made him run but something about putting this in his ears and massaging it in just makes his eyelids lower and it smells very good. His ears smell fresh alot longer than his bath does and i also noticed his ears doesn't have that discoloring that can come from the ears not being cleaned in awhile. I believe the bubbling action gets deep down in the ears alot better than the alcohol based or non-foaming cleansers. I have a thick coated mini schnauzer so those who have schnauzers understand how fast the hair grows in their ears. I absolutely recommend this product. you and your pet will love it
customer_reviews.author: the mrs.

customer_reviews.title: Quality ear cleaner for our GSD with chronic ear infections
customer_reviews.text: Our shepherd has chronic ear infections and to avoid the bi-monthly vet visits we bought this. I’m impressed to say the least ! It works just as well (if not better) than the prescribed ear cleaner, doesn’t cause any pain (which is a HUGE plus), and it’s a pretty big container so it lasts a long time ! Will be buying again, and again.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It worked well of course my cat didn’t like it but if you follow the instructions carefully, it will work very well!
customer_reviews.author: Ally G

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work, but very highly fragranced
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to work to clean my cat's ears. It (according to everything that I've read) is essentially gentle and as effective as that used by the vet. However, it is VERY perfumy, and I have to wash my cat's face (and everything else) after using it. That "after ear cleaning headshake" leaves a bathroom full of perfumy stink that smells like carpet shampoo or something.
customer_reviews.author: eec

customer_reviews.title: Best yet
customer_reviews.text: I used this as a tech in the vers office. So far it is the best I have found for their ears. Breaks up wax and yeast build up very well
customer_reviews.author: It Again

customer_reviews.title: Works Good
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats seems to get a lot of earwax in his ears all the time (for some odd reason). This stuff does the trick. I tested it on a part of his ear before using it and he's never had any sort of reaction to it. I just put a little bit on a cotton pad and wipe out as much wax as I can. Definitely keeps his ears clean and it dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: Decided to give this a try because it was so much less expensive than the Trizultra plus keto I got from the vet, but it didn't work at all for my dog, a cockapoo. His ears got very red, and I had to go back to the prescription product from the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Great for my puppy
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice after I gave my puppy baths. I squirt it in his ears, rub his ears to get it in there and then I use a cotton ball to clean out his ear. He tries to shake his head right away after I squirt it in so I hold his head to prevent that. It seems like a great product.
customer_reviews.author: KTornow

customer_reviews.title: Our dog had an allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: I opened this product 2 days ago and used it to clean our dogs ears. She woke up this morning with red, inflamed, itchy ears. Heading to the vet as soon as it opens.
customer_reviews.author: Jmom

customer_reviews.title: it came un damage thats  a good thing
customer_reviews.text: it came in good shape in a clear plastic inclosed bag . it drys up any liquid in the ears and cleans
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: It cleans the ears but hurts my dog
customer_reviews.text: My only set back is my dog yelps in pain. It does work but I can't hurt my fur baby. I've found products that are not so painful to clean his ears. It may be just my dog being a wimp but I just can't stand hurting him. I bought this product because I've seen the Vet I take my boy to uses it as well. When my dog sees the bottle he will try everything in his power to get away.
customer_reviews.author: T.E.G

customer_reviews.title: this stuff smells terrible. i used it once on my dog and ...
customer_reviews.text: this stuff smells terrible. i used it once on my dog and now it just sits in my cupboard. there are better products out there. dont waste your cash money
customer_reviews.author: kelso

product_meta.title: Virbac Epi-Otic Advanced Ear Cleaner, 8 oz
feature_bullets: Epi-Otic may be used for routine ear cleansing in healthy ear canal or prior to administration of other ear preparations
A mild alcohol-free cleansing and drying solution for routine maintenance of otitis externa
Epi-Otic has a low pH of 2.2 and contains no chlorhexidine or alcohol
